definition: enemy/to be a match for/to rival/to resist/to withstand
anger against a common enemy (idiom); joined in opposition to the same adversary

sentences.english: On the table, we have decided to work together to deal with heifengshuangsha.
sentences.chinese: 饭桌上，大家同仇敌忾决定一起对付黑风双煞。

sentences.english: It is more likely to be tumbleweed time around the stands.
sentences.chinese: 这更像是看台上同仇敌忾的气氛。

definition: anger against a common enemy (idiom); joined in opposition to the same adversary
Tartar (derogatory)/also used as an insulting term for Manchus around 1900
(literary) foreign aggression/external threat/humiliation inflicted by outsiders
facing a powerful enemy (idiom); fig. confronting grave difficulties/Enemy at the Gates, 1991 movie by Jean-Jacques Annaud
blood shed in a just cause
foreign devil/wartime term of abuse for Japanese
jackal and wolf/ravenous wolf/fig. evil person/vicious tyrant
